com.mousebird.maply
Class ScreenMarker

java.lang.Object
  com.mousebird.maply.ScreenMarker

public class ScreenMarker
extends java.lang.Object

The screen marker is a 2D rectangle that tracks a certain position in geographic (lon/lat in radians). Specific information set within this object and more general information in the associated MarkerInfo.

Field Summary
 int color
          Background color for a marker can be overridden at this level.
 NamedBitmap image
          If set, this is the image we'll use for this marker.
 float layoutImportance
          This is the importance value passed to the layout engine.
 Point2d loc
          The location in geographic (WGS84) radians.
 Point2d offset
          If non-null an offset to tweak the label by.
 double rotation
          If non-zero we'll rotate the label that number of radians around the attachment point.
 boolean selectable
          Turn this on if you want the marker object to be selectable.
 Point2d size
          Size of the marker on screen.
 java.lang.Object userObject
          For selection, we include a user accessible object pointer.
 
Constructor Summary
ScreenMarker()

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Field Detail

loc

public Point2d loc
The location in geographic (WGS84) radians. x is longitude, y is latitude. The marker will track this location.

size

public Point2d size
Size of the marker on screen.

rotation

public double rotation
If non-zero we'll rotate the label that number of radians around the attachment point.

image

public NamedBitmap image
If set, this is the image we'll use for this marker. You'll need to set up the NamedBitmap, but the MaplyController will track the rest, including information about reuse.

color

public int color
Background color for a marker can be overridden at this level.

layoutImportance

public float layoutImportance
This is the importance value passed to the layout engine. Layout will take place in importance priority. Set it to MAX_VALUE to avoid layout entirely.

offset

public Point2d offset
If non-null an offset to tweak the label by. We'll move the label this number of pixels from where it normally would be.

selectable

public boolean selectable
Turn this on if you want the marker object to be selectable.

userObject

public java.lang.Object userObject
For selection, we include a user accessible object pointer. You use this to identify a marker if you're doing user selection.

Constructor Detail

ScreenMarker

public ScreenMarker()
